page.title: 20Summary And Acknowledgements
page.content: The Whitchurch area was mentioned in the original Domesday Book of 1086.No specific village merited its own entry,but the whole district was designated as belonging to the 50 hides of Keynsham.Keynsham had a large abbey which administered the surrounding villages up until the time of the Dissolution of the Monasteries. Whitchurch has changed a great deal since these times and we are pleased that an updated account of life in our area is being included on the 1986 Domesday videodisc. Our entry was compiled through the joint efforts of the following schools Bridge Farm Junior Bridge Farm Infants Perry Court Junior Wansdyke Primary Whitchurch Primary with assistance from local residents.
